title: How much does it cost to have a baby? Top hacks to help you save money when pregnant
text:
Money How much does it cost to have a baby? Top hacks to help you save money when pregnant Starting a family can be expensive, but there are plenty of ways you can save money - you just need to know where to look Share Cut the cost of having a baby - Here's all the things to know and do when you see the two blue lines (Photo: Getty) Share Get money updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Whilst having a baby is a joyous occasion, when parents to be start to list all the things they need the cost soon mounts up. 
If you're not sure exactly how much it costs to have a baby, insurance firm LV= have valued the total expense of caring for a child until they're 21 at a whopping £229,251 - that's more expensive than buying a house in some areas. 
But to help worried expectant parents cut costs, we rifled through advice from cash savvy Hot UK Deals members to compile a helpful list of top money-saving things you can do when you find out you've got a baby on the way. 
From major retailer's parenting clubs with the best freebies, to money you may be able to claim from the government, our round-up help you avoid money worries and save some cash, so you can sit back and enjoy the new addition to your family. Read More Top money-saving tips for having a baby Get 10x advantage card points and free vitamins Join Boots' parenting club for top deals and discounts until your child turns three (Photo: Getty) 
High street chain Boots have a parenting club , which offers a range of discounts on baby essentials, including boosted Advantage card reward points on all your baby and maternity purchases until your child turns three. 
To be part of the parenting club you need to join the Advantage card points scheme , and you'll then receive special offers from Boots , tailored to each stage of your pregnancy. 
Deals range from free Folic Acid and vitamin D tablets to discounts on baby clothing and 25% off mum-to-be products. Read More Argos launch huge baby and toddler sale on thousands of items, including baby monitors, high chairs and sterilisers Sign up to cash back sites like Topcashback and Quidco If you're buying it anyway you may as well get paid for it. Reap the benefits of cashback websites (Photo: Getty) 
Earn as you spend as well as collecting freebies, by signing up to a free cashback site like - Topcashback or Quidco . 
Topcashback states that their members earn an average of £325 a year - that's an extra £325 you can put back into your pocket. 
How does it work? Basically, when you buy something online, cashback sites will give you a percentage of that spend back. For example, if you spend £10 on a pack of nappies at Boots and there is 10% cashback, you'll get £1 back. 
Instead of shopping directly through a store online, you access the retailer through a cashback website - like Topcashback or Quidco - who will then get paid (by the brand) for 'referring' you to them. 
Your transaction will continue as normal and your item will still arrive directly from the retailer, but the cashback website will pay you a cut of this payment as a reward for using its services and as an incentive to encourage you to return. How to find the cheapest nappies Whatever your approach, you'll need hundreds of nappies - here's the cheapest places to buy them 
No matter how much you try to avoid it - you will go through huge amounts of nappies. Stock up on as many free samples as you can, as soon as you find out, such as these free Aldi Mamia nappies and wipes from Net Mums . 
When you download the Bounty app you'll also get baby freebies such as vouchers and samples. If you collect yours from Tesco stores you'll get the bumper Bounty mum-to-be pack, which also includes a 25 pack of nappies and a packet of wipes. 
The BumDeal App lets you find the cheapest nappy in the size and brand you need. 
It's also worth signing up to every major brand's newsletters to stay up-to-date with their latest offers. We suggest Boots , Superdrug , Asda , Tesco , Morrisons and Amazon , who all host regular seasonal baby sale events. Read More Get £100 off at Mothercare Mothercare gives parents a plethora of vouchers and exclusive discount codes (Photo: Getty) 
Like Boots, Mothercare also offers a range of discounts especially for expectant parents. 
By signing up to My Mothercare , parents can get over £100 of exclusive money-off vouchers, discounts on car seats, maternity clothes and toys. 
We recommend signing up to as many mother and baby sites as you can, all of which will offer different discounts and freebies. Some of our favourites are Asda baby & toddler club , Toys R Us , Pampers , SMA nutrition and CaringEveryday . 
You could even try creating a separate email to sign up to them all with, as you'll likely get a lot of messages. Read More Mothercare discounts: Save an extra 10% off maternity and baby clothing plus 50% off car seats and nursery furniture Don't be afraid to buy second hand Clothes are a great thing to buy pre-owned as kids outgrow them within just a few months (Photo: Getty) 
Auction sites like eBay are a great place to get cheap baby clothes as it's easy to stay on budget - simply stop bidding when the price becomes too high. Just put them through the washing machine before you use them and they'll be good as new. 
While we strongly recommend never buying a second hand car seat (it may have been weakened over time), you can also get rigorously tested items off the auction site on high street shops' official eBay clearance sections, which include all the usual safety and money-back guarantees - at a significantly cheaper price. 
For example, Argos' eBay clearance store sells a selection of cheap push chairs , stair gates , car sears , high chairs and baby monitors . Get free parenting books on Kindle Becoming a parent is both exciting and terrifying and the best way to prepare for it is to read (Photo: Getty) 
Before you head down to WH Smith for your dose of professional advice, try checking out the huge selection of free parenting books on the Kindle, such as 100 Hidden Truths of Parenting by Ohad Ouziel , Discipline Without Shouting or Spanking by Barbara Unell and many other free titles from top authors . 
Not got a Kindle? The cheapest Kindle version sells for £59.99 across all the major retailers including Amazon , John Lewis and Currys , all with free UK delivery. Alternatively, you can download the Kindle app ( for Apple , Android or directly from Amazon ) to use on your smartphone or tablet. Read More Get free prescriptions To get free NHS prescriptions, you'll need to fill in this form (Photo: Getty) 
Thanks to your little one, you're now entitled to free NHS prescriptions from now until the baby is one - on one condition. 
You need to fill in the FW8 form, so ask your midwife (or GP/health visitor) for a copy, which they also need to sign. For more information on this head to the official NHS page here . Get free dental treatment Did you know pregnant women get to see the denist for free? Here's how (Photo: Getty) 
As well as free prescriptions at the doctors, you're also now entitled to free dental treatment and prescriptions. 
For this, you'll need a MATB form (which you can also get from your midwife or GP) which covers you until the baby is 1 year old. For more information on getting your free dental treatment go to the official NHS page here . Read More
